intro: Galium urvillei, commonly known as the Urville's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It features slender, ascending stems and small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
